com.navis.framework.portal.cache

Interface IEntityCache<K extends java.io.Serializable,V extends java.io.Serializable>

  • Type Parameters:
    K - cache key type. Serializable due to expected role as ValueHolder key
    V - cache value type
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IAllocationGroupCache, IAllocationRangeCache, IAscMoveCache, ICheCache, ILivePositionableCache, IPointOfWorkCache, IUfvAllocationGroupCache, IVesselVisitCache, IWorkQueueCache, IWorkShiftCache, IYardInventoryMap
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractEntityCache, AbstractFacilityObjectCache, AbstractYardObjectCache, AllocationGroupCache, AllocationRangeCache, AscMoveCache, CheCache, LivePositionableCache, PointOfWorkCache, UfvAllocationGroupCache, VesselVisitCache, WorkQueueCache, WorkShiftCache, YardInventory

    public interface IEntityCache<K extends java.io.Serializable,V extends java.io.Serializable>
    This interface provides map-like operations and views for a cached entity. The entities are fetched during startup (usually from database) and stored in the cache
    Author:
    Arvinder Brar, 2016-01-14

    • Field Detail

      • MOST_RECENT_UPDATE_FOR_CACHED_ENTITY

        static final MetafieldId MOST_RECENT_UPDATE_FOR_CACHED_ENTITY
        This holds the ValueObject of most recent update for the cached entity. Can be used by subscribers to make a decision if the udate is of interest to them or not

        java.util.Optional<V> get(K inKey)
        Returns a cached entity for a given gkey
        Parameters:
        inKey - gkey for which entity ValueHolder is to be retrieved
        Returns:
        ValueHolder in cache for the given key

      • get

        java.util.Map<K,V> get(java.util.Set<K> inKeys)
        Returns a Map of Gkey and ValueHolder corresponding to it for the requested entries in the cache
        Parameters:
        inKeys - The gkeys for which cached entities are desired
        Returns:
        A Map of Gkey and cached entity ValueHolder corresponding to it

      • put

        @Nullable
java.util.Optional<V> put(K inKey,
                                     ValueHolder inEntity)
        Put entity ValueHolder
        Parameters:
        inKey - key of entity
        inEntity - ValueHolder for the entity
        Returns:
        optional of previous ValueHolder for the entity with same key

      • merge

        void merge(@NotNull
           java.lang.String inUpdatedEntityName,
           @NotNull
           ValueHolder inUpdatedValues)
        A merge operation returns a new immutable instance as a result of a merge
        Parameters:
        inUpdatedEntityName - the update entity name (cache entity or any related entity whose update affects object in cache, that is, cached entity value holder has a (compound)field of that entity)
        inUpdatedValues - the target entity ValueHolder of the merge

      • remove

        java.util.Optional<V> remove(K inKey)
        Remove ValueHolder of entity from cache
        Parameters:
        inKey - key of entity to be removed
        Returns:
        optional of entity ValueHolder (may not have pre-existing entry)

      • getRelatedEntityKeys

        @NotNull
default com.google.common.collect.ImmutableList<Tuple<java.lang.String,java.lang.Long>> getRelatedEntityKeys(@NotNull
                                                                                                                       ValueHolder inValueHolder,
                                                                                                                       @NotNull
                                                                                                                       java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<MetafieldId>> inRelatedEntityNameKeyMap)
        Returns a tuple of related(foreign key) entity name and foreign key(s) for that related entity in given entity (value holder)
        Parameters:
        inValueHolder - value holder
        inRelatedEntityNameKeyMap - map of related entity name -> List of foreign key metafields; usually there is only one but there can be multiple foreign keys for same entity like a WorkInstruction has multiple fields for Che entity (WI_ITV, WI_CHE, WI_NOMINATED_CHE and so on)
        Returns:
        a tuple of related(foreign key) entity name and foreign key value in given entity (value holder)

java.lang.String getEntityName()
